meanings.definition: To remove or withdraw (troops, data, etc.) from an area covertly.
meanings.sent1: The spy had to exfiltrate the secret documents without being noticed.
meanings.sent2: The special forces team needed to exfiltrate the injured soldier from enemy territory.
meanings.sent3: Trying to exfiltrate the cookies from the jar without Mom seeing became a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: She managed to exfiltrate herself from the boring party by pretending to receive an urgent call.
meanings.sent5: The ninja's ability to exfiltrate silently made him a master of stealth.

meanings.definition: To steal or smuggle out (information, documents, etc.).
meanings.sent1: The hacker attempted to exfiltrate sensitive data from the company's database.
meanings.sent2: Criminals often exfiltrate valuable artifacts from museums to sell on the black market.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon seemed to exfiltrate snacks from the picnic basket whenever no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes seemed to exfiltrate all the beauty of the sunset and store it in her memory.
meanings.sent5: The thief's plan to exfiltrate the jewels was foiled by the vigilant security guard.

meanings.sent1: The exfiltrate of the troops was executed smoothly under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent2: Witnessing the exfiltrate of classified documents raised suspicions within the organization.
meanings.sent3: The cat's exfiltrate of the toy mouse from the room amused the children.
meanings.sent4: The exfiltrate of emotions from her heart left her feeling empty and numb.
meanings.sent5: The exfiltrate of students from the school during the fire drill was orderly and quick.
